Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 06:14 -  Hi David here. I'm sorry for how long the power was off especially on this festive period. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue works on the underground network in the Westcliff Drive area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Theo at 15:52 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Norwich Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an underground network fault, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Sent by Stuart at 12:10 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 311 customers in the Feltwell IP26 4 area, by diverting power around an overhead cable fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Stuart from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 11:33 - Hello again. Thanks for your patience today, I can see from our engineer's notes that your lights may have come on and gone back off several times since we've been made aware of the issue, and I'm sorry if this is causing you any worry. As we've explained in previous messages, our staff work to divert power when a fault like this happens. Sometimes, these diversions can be unsuccessful, so we have to try routing power another way; this is why your lights are going off and on. If at any point your power comes back on, you can always stop SMS updates here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:27. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

We have been alerted to a potentially dangerous situation involving a low hanging overhead line, so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Once further specialist field staff have assessed the situation, we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 12:00 and 13:00. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.

Sent by Stuart at 12:25 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 16:22 - We can now confirm that all power in the Broadway area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 15:32
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Broadway area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Theo at 15:22.

Sent by Kevin at 21:35 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the London Road area should now be back on.

Our staff have restored your power by replacing our substation safety equipment. Following the results of their tests, the underground cable fault we believe is causing these issues has not yet become visible, so for the moment we have restored your power as fast as possible.

I'm very sorry for the continued disruption, but this may happen again before we're able to fix it. If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 18:07 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Kevin at 21:16 - We can now confirm that all power in the Kingston Hill area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Hi, this is Kevin - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.

Sent by Will at 20:40 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-DEC-2025 23:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
